column4:
A tribute to Mumbai’s greatest storyteller—the Mumbai local train. The Railway Shirt is hand-painted with the rhythm of the city, where every compartment carries a slice of life and every journey becomes a shared tale. Look closer and you’ll find moments—voices raised in banter, songs born from strangers, hands reaching out just in time.

Hand-painted with the spirit of connection, of lives briefly intertwined before the next stop. Because in Mumbai, a train ride is never just a commute—it’s where the city breathes, moves, and belongs.

Garment Measurements (In Inches)

  Chest Length Sleeve Length Shoulder
XS 38 26 18 14
S 42 26.5 18.5 14.5
M 46 27 19 15
L 50 27 19 15.5
XL 54 27.5 19.5 16
XXL 58 28 20 16.5
column15:
We believe all fabrics deserve to be treated well, and our fabrics are particularly delicate and lightweight. 
So please remember to be gentle when you wash your piece. Avoid scrubbing. 
We recommend you use a liquid detergent for washing. 
Colors tend to last longer if clothes are not exposed to direct sunlight.

Only machine/ hand wash, no dry cleaning required!

column4:
An homage to Bombay’s black-and-yellow heartbeat, the Padmini Shirt captures the dual rhythm of the city’s iconic kaali peeli taxis—rest and rush, pause and pace.

On the front, a quiet moment: taxi drivers at ease, swapping stories, sipping chai, reading the morning paper—finding stillness amid the city's relentless motion. Turn around, and the mood shifts—the back comes alive with a flurry of kaali peelis racing out of CST, echoing the urgency, energy, and endless movement of Mumbai.

A shirt painted with the everyday poetry of the city—where every ride has a story, and every stop is only a moment before the next beginning.

M 46 26 13 18

column4:
The Irani Top is a gentle tribute to Bombay’s beloved Iranian cafés—first of it's likes, Yazdani Bakery—where time stretches, hearts rest, and the city takes a breath.
With hand-painted details in front and back, it feels like sitting among a thousand stories—of love, loss, and everyday life. Worn like a moment of stillness in a fast city, the Irani Top invites you to pause, linger, and belong.

column4:
Inspired by the quiet grace of the Asiatic Society of Mumbai, the Manuscript Shirt is a tribute to a city’s oldest storyteller.

Hand-painted with motifs drawn from old libraries, winding staircases, and the textured stillness of yellowed pages, this shirt echoes the neoclassical calm of a place where time gently lingers. It evokes the memory of thinkers seated on stone steps, of manuscripts cradled by curious hands, and of Bombay before it became Mumbai.

For the dreamers, the readers, and the ones who pause—this piece is a wearable page from a slower, wiser world.

column4:
A love letter to Bombay’s golden era of cinema, the Theatre Dress captures the quiet magic of shared stories on the big screen. The sheer organza overlay features hand-painted silhouettes of people gathered in anticipation—different lives, one moment. Beneath it, the inner silk slip carries a painted screen, visible through the fabric, like a scene unfolding in a darkened hall. It’s a piece about nostalgia and community where the reel spins, and reality fades.

column4:
Painted with nostalgia and the unspoken poetry of the streets, the Premier Shirt is an ode to Bombay’s iconic Kaali Peeli taxis—those black-and-yellow chariots that have seen it all. From early morning auditions to midnight heartbreaks, they’ve carried the city's many stories.
With glimpses of taxi stands and fleeting journeys, this shirt remembers the men behind the wheel—drivers who sip cutting chai at quiet nukkads, play cards on worn cloths, and know every corner of Mumbai not by signs, but by stories.

column4:
A tribute to the timeless elegance of Bombay’s Art Deco era, the Eros Dress draws inspiration from the iconic Eros Cinema building, while soft, flowing details reflect the quiet resilience of city life. Like the man moving through Bombay’s bustle on his cycle—balancing trays of fragile eggs with care and hope—this piece holds a story of grace, balance, and strength. An ode to the beauty that lives in both architecture and the everyday.

column4:
A quiet salute to Mumbai’s most trusted delivery men—the dabbawalas. The Tiffin Shirt carries the poetry of precision and the warmth of home-cooked meals tucked into every hand-painted detail.

Inspired by the morning rituals of men in white topis weaving through crowds and trains, this piece captures the unsung rhythm of the city. With tiffins in hand and stories in stride, they navigate chaos with grace—no GPS, just a coded system and a shared trust.

Wearing the Tiffin Shirt is a nod to the everyday heroes who keep the city moving and hearts full—one home-packed meal at a time.

The Marine Dress is inspired by the spirit of Bombay’s beloved Marine Drive—a place where the city breathes a little easier. Designed to capture the feeling of openness and flow, this dress mirrors the meeting point of people, stories, and the sea. It’s where strangers share sunsets, dreams feel a little more possible, and the chaos of the city softens with the waves. A piece that holds space—for freedom, for movement, for you.

column4:
A tale of two Bombays—hand-painted in one shirt. The Taj Shirt brings together the grandeur of the first Taj Hotel with the resilience of Dharavi’s lived reality. On the front, clean lines and a hand-painted Taj reflect structure, pride, and legacy. Turn around, and the back tells a different story—raw edges, a tie-up detail, and hand-drawn homes that speak of ingenuity and survival. Just 12 km apart, these two worlds exist side by side. This shirt is a reminder of the contrasts we carry, and the strength that binds them.

Hand-painted with iconic palm trees and a delicate sun setting behind them, this dress captures the essence of laid-back coastal beauty

Made from soft, breathable cotton in yellow colour, the Sukh Dress is designed for easygoing comfort and simplicity

It’s a versatile piece that you can effortlessly reach for, perfect for embracing those carefree moments and enjoying the simple pleasures of life
column15:
• Avoid scrubbing
• Use a liquid detergent for washing
• Colors tend to last longer if clothes are not exposed to direct sunlight
• Only machine/ hand wash, no dry cleaning required!
